skill.name: react-native-architecture
skill.description: Build production React Native apps with Expo, navigation, native modules, offline sync, and cross-platform patterns. Use when developing mobile apps, implementing native integrations, or architecting React Native projects.
skill.summary: Build production React Native apps with Expo, navigation, native modules, offline sync, and cross-pl...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: The skill is documentation-only with example snippets. It does not execute code, access files, or make network requests.

content.value_statement: Complex React Native apps can become hard to scale and maintain. This skill provides proven Expo architecture patterns and examples.
actual_capabilities: Explain a recommended Expo project folder structure
Provide Expo Router navigation layout patterns
Outline an authentication flow with route protection
Describe offline-first caching with React Query
Show native module integrations for haptics and biometrics
Recommend list and render performance optimizations
limitations: Does not run commands or modify project files
Does not provide app specific API schemas or endpoints
Does not manage store credentials or signing
Does not debug device specific crashes

use_cases.title: Plan app structure
use_cases.description: Define folder layout, routing groups, and providers for a new React Native app.

use_cases.title: Add offline sync
use_cases.description: Choose React Query persistence and optimistic update patterns for offline usage.

use_cases.title: Improve performance
use_cases.description: Select list rendering and memoization strategies for large datasets.

prompt_templates.title: Start a new app
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest a React Native project structure and Expo Router layout for tabs plus authentication.

prompt_templates.title: Add auth flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide an AuthProvider pattern with route protection and secure token storage.

prompt_templates.title: Offline first data
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain offline caching, optimistic updates, and invalidation with React Query.

prompt_templates.title: Native integrations
prompt_templates.prompt: List best practices for haptics, biometrics, and push notifications in Expo.

output_examples.input: Outline an Expo Router structure with auth and tabs
output: Use a root layout to set shared providers
Define tab screens with consistent icons

best_practices: Use Expo Router groups to organize navigation flows
Persist queries for offline access and fast startup
Test on real devices for platform behavior
anti_patterns: Storing secrets directly in source code
Ignoring iOS and Android UI differences

faq.question: Is this compatible with Expo and bare React Native?
faq.answer: Yes. It focuses on Expo but notes when bare React Native differs.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides architecture patterns and examples, not full app builds.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with an existing app?
faq.answer: Yes. The patterns can be adapted to your current structure.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. It is documentation only and does not access files or networks.

faq.question: What if the examples do not match my setup?
faq.answer: Share your constraints and it can tailor the architecture guidance.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic React Native tips?
faq.answer: It focuses on production architecture, routing, offline sync, and native modules.
